column4: is there a way to open all the ports in ubuntu? iptables -F is not working, in fact i removed the firewall from the system and i still get All 1714 scanned ports on localhost are close from nmap localhost
but i have to open them
then install some service, say opnessh-server
if the service is running, then it's listening on a port, and nstat and nmap both would show it
ps aux | grep ssh shows /usr/sbin/sshd and ssh running
looks like 2222 is open and listening on all interfaces
nmap tells me everything is closed
what is the nmap command you are running? nmap only scans the priv ports (up to 1024)
nmap is useful, but it's doing syn packet port scanning looking for acks. i could easily block those
